0.9.4 Acquiring X / Twitter accounts
1.1.2 Using profile pictures like created using generative adversarial networks (GAN)
Indicator: This operations ran accounts appeared to have been acquired from Bangladesh, with many starting out with GAN profile photos and later changing to other images

Procedure: 1.2.8 Posing as fictional person in target region
Indicator: Their fictitious personas pretended to be living in states like Arizona, Michigan, Nevada, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Wisconsin, and North Carolina. To seem more credible, they often interspersed the PRP-related posts with local content related to state sports teams and events, and local restaurant check-ins, in addition to political memes which they copied from other people on the internet.

Procedure: 1.3.2 Creating fictitious NGO
Indicator: This campaign centered around a fictitious political advocacy group – the Patriots Run Project or PRP

Procedure: 1.8.1 Backstopping fictitious individual across multiple websites
Indicator: This operation included websites and social media accounts, including on our apps and X (formerly Twitter).

Procedure: 2.2.1 Monitoring breaking news
Indicator: The network posted about US elections and primaries.

Procedure: 5.4.2 Copying authentic social media posts
Indicator: The fake accounts copied political memes from other people on the internet.

Procedure: 5.5.1 Using proxy IP in target country
Indicator: This operation’s fictitious personas maintained relative operational security (OpSec) by using proxies to pretend to be living in the particular states this campaign targeted.

Procedure: 6.1.1 Posting original content on websites
Indicator: This operation included websites that represented the state chapters of PRP in states like Arizona, Michigan, Nevada, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Wisconsin, and North Carolina.

Technique: 6.2 Amplifying with likely fake accounts on social media
Procedure: 6.2.1 Amplifying with likely fake accounts on Facebook
Indicator: Fake accounts were used to  amplify PRP’s content to make it appear more popular than it was

Procedure: 7.1.1 Advertising to promote content
Indicator: Around $50,000 in spending for ads on Facebook, paid for mostly in US dollars.

Technique: 7.2 Engaging with users outside the operation
Procedure: 7.2.2 Acquiring Page followers
Indicator: About 1,700 accounts followed one or more of these Pages

Technique: 7.2 Engaging with users outside the operation
Procedure: 7.2.4 Acquiring Instagram followers
Indicator: about 2,300 accounts followed this Instagram account

7.6.1 Posting negative content about named individuals or institutions
Indicator: The network posted about US elections and primaries, including criticisms of “Republican and Democrat elites”, “God”, “guns”, and “illegal immigrants.”
